I've introduced Scrum to several projects at my company (with two more
in t=
he way). While the groups that are practicing Scrum are fairly
advanced and=
 use unit testing (some even do TDD), there is still a
broad community with=
in our organisation that has never even considered
Unit Testing/TDD (some e=
ven at the bottom of services stack).

I'm going to organize a series of lu=
nch and learn sessions to workshop
J.B.'s book and help make unit testing p=
art of the everyday culture.
To kick this off I need a kick ass presentatio=
n that will demonstrate
the value of TDD and Unit testing. The goal of the =
presentation: sell
people on TDD and motivate people to spend 10-12 weeks w=
orkshopping
the book at lunch. I was wondering is anyone aware of any
prese=
ntations that would make a good starting point? Or will I have to
write my =
own scratch?

My rough plan
  - Discuss the benefits of Unit testing
  - Wo=
rk through a body of existing code, writing tests and
refactoring as we go =
- demonstrating how unit tests can force us to
simplify our code.

In addit=
ion any pointers on how people organise sessions like this
would also help =
- however I will try to make this as participant
driven as possible.

What =
are your favorite presentations? How have you organized lunch and
learn ses=
sions?

BTW I have googled on the subject and haven't found anything of gre=
at
quality. Before I sink several days of effort I thought I would ask you.=


Thanks
Mark Levison
